<P STYLE="margin-top: 0; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Fay
Matsukage</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">8480
E. Orchard Road, Ste. 2000, Greenwood Village, CO 80111</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Phone:
720.306.1001&#9679;  E-Mail: fay@doidalaw.com &#9679; Web: www.doidalaw.com</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">June
7, 2018</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Intiva
BioPharma Inc.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">4340
East Kentucky Avenue, Suite 206</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Glendale,
CO 80246</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Ladies
and Gentlemen:</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">We
have acted as counsel to Intiva BioPharma Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &ldquo;<B><I>Company</I></B>&rdquo;), in connection
with the filing by the Company of a Registration Statement on Form S-1 (the &ldquo;<B><I>Registration Statement</I></B>&rdquo;)
with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including a related prospectus filed with the Registration Statement (the &ldquo;<B><I>Prospectus</I></B>&rdquo;),
covering 1,253,955 shares of the Company&rsquo;s Common Stock, par value $0.0001 per share, to be sold by selling stockholders
identified in such Registration Statement (the &ldquo;<B><I>Stockholder Shares</I></B>&rdquo;).</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">In
connection with this opinion, we have examined and relied upon (a) the Registration Statement and related Prospectus, (b) the
Company&rsquo;s Certificate of Incorporation, as amended, and Bylaws, both as currently in effect as of the date hereof, and (c)
the originals or copies certified to our satisfaction of such records, documents, certificates, memoranda and other instruments
as in our judgment are necessary or appropriate to enable us to render the opinion expressed below.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">We
have assumed the genuineness and authenticity of all documents submitted to us as originals, and the conformity to originals of
all documents submitted to us as copies and the due execution and delivery, other than by the Company, of all documents where
due execution and delivery are prerequisites to the effectiveness thereof. As to certain factual matters, we have relied upon
a certificate of an officer of the Company and have not sought to independently verify such matters. Our opinion is expressed
only with respect to the General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware. We express no opinion to the extent that any other
laws are applicable to the subject matter hereof and provide no assurance as to compliance with any federal or state securities
law, rule or regulation.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
the basis of the foregoing, and in reliance thereon, we are of the opinion that the Stockholder Shares have been validly issued
and are fully paid and non-assessable.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">We
consent to the reference to our firm under the caption &ldquo;Interest of Named Experts and Counsel&rdquo; in the Prospectus included
in the Registration Statement and to the filing of this opinion as an exhibit to the Registration Statement.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top: 0; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>Exhibit
21.1</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>LIST
OF SUBSIDIARIES</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">The
registrant has the following subsidiaries:</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Intiva
BioPharma Inc., a Colorado corporation (&ldquo;BioPharma&rdquo;). It does not do business under any other name.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">BioPharma
has two subsidiaries:</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">

of these subsidiaries does business under any other names.</FONT></P>

    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2017-07-01to2018-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 6 &amp;#8211;Related Party Transactions&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;BioPharma was formed as a subsidiary&#13;of Intiva USA, which is a subsidiary of Kanativa Inc. (formerly INTIVA Inc.).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;At June 30, 2017, BioPharma was owed&#13;$141,329 from Intiva USA for advances made by BioPharma on behalf of Intiva USA in conjunction with the Share Exchange Agreement&#13;(See Note 3). During the nine months ended March 31, 2018, $26,662 was repaid by Intiva USA. The balance due from Intiva USA at&#13;March 31, 2018 of $114,667 is classified as a current asset on the accompanying March 31, 2018 consolidated balance sheet.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In March 2018, the Company cancelled&#13;1,166,667 unvested shares of common stock previously issued to its former CEO under the Company&amp;#8217;s 2017 Stock Incentive Plan.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s Chairman, and Chief&#13;Financial Officer are also officers and/or a director of Kanativa Inc., and other subsidiaries and affiliated entities of Kanativa&#13;Inc.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2017-03-27to2017-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 6 &amp;#8211; Related Party Transactions&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;BioPharma was formed as a subsidiary&#13;of Intiva USA, which is a subsidiary of Kanativa Inc. (formerly Intiva Inc.).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Intiva USA was issued 24,000,000 shares&#13;of BioPharma&amp;#8217;s common stock as consideration for its contribution of 100% of the ownership of Intiva Kotzker, and costs and&#13;expenses incurred on behalf of BioPharma and Intiva Kotzker in the amount of $201,228. Included in the consideration for the issuance&#13;of the common stock is $172,915 of capitalized license agreement costs comprised of (i) the value of Kanativa Inc. common stock&#13;issued to Kotzker Consulting of $78,875 and (ii) payments to Kotzker Consulting and legal costs in the aggregate of $94,040 (See&#13;Note 4).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;At June 30, 2017, BioPharma was owed&#13;$141,329 from Intiva USA for advances made by BioPharma on behalf of Intiva USA in conjunction with the Share Exchange Agreement&#13;(See Note 3). Subsequent to June 30, 2017, $25,000 has been repaid by Intiva USA.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s Chairman, former&#13;Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer are also officers and/or directors of Kanativa Inc., and other subsidiaries&#13;and affiliated entities of Kanativa Inc.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2017-07-01to2018-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 7 &amp;#8211; Subsequent Events&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On April 22, 2018, the Company extended&#13;the expiration date of its Class B Warrants from May 7, 2018, to June 7, 2018.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Through June 5, 2018, &lt;font style="background-color: white"&gt;90,400&#13;&lt;/font&gt;Class B warrants have been exercised at $0.38 per share for total proceeds of $34,352&lt;font style="color: #222222"&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 4, 2018, the Company extended&#13;the expiration dates of its Class B Warrants and Class C Warrants from June 7, 2018 to June 29, 2018 and from July 14, 2018 to&#13;July 27, 2018, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2017-03-27to2017-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 8 &amp;#8211; Subsequent Events&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In July and August 2017, BioPharma sold&#13;338,000 units of its Common Stock and Warrants pursuant to a private placement, for gross proceeds of $422,500 (See Note 5).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2017, the Company paid the&#13;$65,000 balance due under the License Agreement with Kotzker Consulting LLC (See Note 4).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On August 10, 2017, BioPharma adopted&#13;the &amp;#8220;2017 Stock Incentive Plan&amp;#8221; and granted an aggregate of 6,400,000 shares of BioPharma Common Stock to five officers&#13;and directors of the Company. One-third of each grant vested as of the initial date of grant (August 10, 2017), and 8-1/3% upon&#13;the end of each calendar quarter beginning December 31, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On August 25, 2017, BioPharma entered&#13;into consulting agreements with two unrelated individuals for (i) developing and maintaining social media portals and (ii) identifying&#13;and developing potential strategic partners for the Company&amp;#8217;s various drug development activities. The agreements are each&#13;for a three-month term, payable monthly in shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, valued at $0.125 per share, of an aggregate&#13;304,800 shares and 138,000 shares, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On September 1, 2017, BioPharma commenced&#13;a private placement sale of its common stock at $0.25 per share. The Company has received subscriptions and payment for 100,000&#13;shares ($25,000).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On September 19, 2017, BioPharma entered&#13;into a contract with a contract manufacturing organization to develop an injectable formulation of a drug product to be submitted&#13;to the FDA. It is anticipated that the product will be developed utilizing the new drug application 505(b) (2) regulatory pathway&#13;for use in the treatment during and immediately following exposure to organophosphorous nerve agents. The drug product is to consist&#13;of a synthetic cannabinoid and a blend of terpenes in an injectable vehicle.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DueFromRelatedPartiesCurrent contextRef="AsOf2018-03-31" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">114667</us-gaap:DueFromRelatedPartiesCurrent>
    <us-gaap:DueFromRelatedPartiesCurrent contextRef="AsOf2017-06-30" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">141329</us-gaap:DueFromRelatedPartiesCurrent>
    <us-gaap:DueFromRelatedPartiesCurrent contextRef="AsOf2017-06-30_custom_IntivaUSAMember" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">141329</us-gaap:DueFromRelatedPartiesCurrent>
    <us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock contextRef="From2017-07-01to2018-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 1 &amp;#8211; Nature of Business&#13;and Basis of Presentation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company was incorporated on November&#13;10, 1952 in Michigan as Gantos, Inc. On July 21, 2008, the Company completed its change in domicile to Delaware and subsequently&#13;changed its name to Kinder Holding Corp. (the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;). As of October 13, 2017, the Company completed a reverse acquisition&#13;of Intiva BioPharma Inc., a Colorado corporation (&amp;#8220;BioPharma&amp;#8221;) through an exchange of shares (the &amp;#8220;Share Exchange&#13;Transaction&amp;#8221;). In connection with the Share Exchange Transaction, the Company changed its name to Intiva BioPharma Inc. on&#13;November 8, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As further described in Note 3, BioPharma&#13;became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. Since this transaction resulted in the existing shareholders of BioPharma acquiring&#13;control of the Company, for financial reporting purposes, the business combination has been accounted for as an additional capitalization&#13;of the Company (a reverse acquisition with BioPharma as the accounting acquirer). The operations of BioPharma were the only continuing&#13;operations of the Company. The accompanying financial statements as of March 31, 2018 and for the three and nine-month periods&#13;ended March 31, 2017 and 2018 present the historical financial information of BioPharma.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;BioPharma was incorporated under the&#13;laws of the State of Colorado on March 27, 2017 to pursue pre-clinical and drug development activities, in accordance with U.S.&#13;Food and Drug Administration (&amp;#8220;FDA&amp;#8221;) protocols, for certain pharmaceutical formulations that include cannabinoids.&#13;It is pursuing the formulation and development of cannabinoid-based drugs for medical conditions and disorders, and owns a license&#13;covering certain intellectual property, including certain patent applications, and has filed six of its own provisional patent&#13;applications for other drugs that include cannabinoids and other substances, including terpenes, that are intended to be developed&#13;with the objective of treating certain medical conditions and disorders. It was formed as a corporate subsidiary of the Colorado&#13;corporation Intiva USA Inc. (&amp;#8220;Intiva USA&amp;#8221;), which is a subsidiary of the Ontario, Canada corporation, INTIVA Inc.,&#13;now known as Kanativa Inc.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;All share and per share amounts have&#13;been adjusted in the footnotes and accompanying financial statements to give effect to the Share Exchange Transaction.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As disclosed in Note 3, for financial&#13;reporting purposes, the Share Exchange Transaction is accounted for as an additional capitalization of BioPharma with BioPharma&#13;as the accounting acquirer (reverse acquirer). The operations of BioPharma are the continuing operations of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial&#13;statements include BioPharma and its wholly owned subsidiaries: Intiva Kotzker Pharmaceuticals Inc. (&amp;#8220;Intiva Kotzker&amp;#8221;)&#13;and Intiva Sharir Inc. (collectively &amp;#8220;the Company&amp;#8221;), and were prepared from the accounts of the Company in accordance&#13;with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (US GAAP). All significant intercompany transactions&#13;and balances have been eliminated on consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis of Presentation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Financial Statements presented herein&#13;have been prepared in accordance with the accounting policies described in the June 30, 2017 audited financial statements and should&#13;be read in conjunction with the notes to financial statements which appear as part of those financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The preparation of these financial statements&#13;in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires us to make estimates and judgments&#13;that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses, and related disclosure of contingent assets and&#13;liabilities. On an ongoing basis, we evaluate our estimates, including those related to intangible assets, income taxes, insurance&#13;obligations and contingencies and litigation. We base our estimates on historical experience and on various other assumptions that&#13;are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying&#13;values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other resources. Actual results may differ from these estimates&#13;under different assumptions or conditions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In the opinion of Management, the information&#13;furnished in these interim financial statements reflects all adjustments necessary for a fair statement of the financial position&#13;and results of operations and cash flows as of March 31, 2018 and for the three and nine-month periods ended March 31, 2017 and&#13;2018. All such adjustments are of a normal recurring nature.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock contextRef="From2017-03-27to2017-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 1 &amp;#8211; Nature of Business&#13;and Basis of Presentation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company was incorporated on November&#13;10, 1952 in Michigan as Gantos, Inc. On July 21, 2008, the Company completed its change in domicile to Delaware and subsequently&#13;changed its name to Kinder Holding Corp. (the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;). As of October 13, 2017, the Company completed a reverse acquisition&#13;of Intiva BioPharma Inc., a Colorado corporation (&amp;#8220;BioPharma&amp;#8221;) through an exchange of shares (the &amp;#8220;Share Exchange&#13;Transaction&amp;#8221;). In connection with the Share Exchange Transaction, the Company changed its name to Intiva BioPharma Inc. on&#13;November 8, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As further described in Note 3, BioPharma&#13;became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. Since this transaction resulted in the existing shareholders of BioPharma acquiring&#13;control of the Company, for financial reporting purposes, the business combination has been accounted for as an additional capitalization&#13;of the Company (a reverse acquisition with BioPharma as the accounting acquirer). The operations of BioPharma were the only continuing&#13;operations of the Company. The accompanying financial statements as of June 30, 2007 and for the period then ended present the&#13;historical financial information of BioPharma.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;BioPharma was incorporated under the&#13;laws of the State of Colorado on March 27, 2017 to pursue pre-clinical and drug development activities, in accordance with U.S.&#13;Food and Drug Administration (&amp;#8220;FDA&amp;#8221;) protocols, for certain pharmaceutical formulations that include cannabinoids.&#13;It is pursuing the formulation and development of cannabinoid-based drugs for medical conditions and disorders, and owns a license&#13;covering certain intellectual property, including certain patent applications, and has filed six of its own provisional patent&#13;applications for other drugs that include cannabinoids and other substances, including terpenes, that are intended to be developed&#13;with the objective of treating certain medical conditions and disorders. It was formed as a corporate subsidiary of the Colorado&#13;corporation Intiva USA Inc. (&amp;#8220;Intiva USA&amp;#8221;), which is a subsidiary of the Ontario, Canada corporation, Kanativa Inc.&#13;(formerly Intiva Inc.).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial&#13;statements include BioPharma and its wholly owned subsidiaries: Intiva Kotzker Pharmaceuticals Inc. (&amp;#8220;Intiva Kotzker&amp;#8221;)&#13;and Intiva Sharir Inc. (collectively &amp;#8220;the Company&amp;#8221;), and were prepared from the accounts of the Company in accordance&#13;with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (US GAAP). All significant intercompany transactions&#13;and balances have been eliminated on consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis of Presentation/Going Concern&#13;Uncertainty&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;All share and per share amounts have&#13;been adjusted in the footnotes and accompanying financial statements to give effect to the Share Exchange Transaction. (See Note&#13;3).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying financial statements&#13;have been prepared in conformity with US GAAP, which contemplates continuation of the Company as a going concern. The Company&#13;has not established any source of revenue to cover its operating costs, and as such, has incurred an operating loss since inception&#13;of $191,432. The development of pharmaceuticals with the objective of obtaining approval by the FDA and other international regulatory&#13;authorities is not a short-term endeavor for any specific drug candidate. It also requires extremely significant amounts of capital&#13;funding for clinical trials and other matters. At June 30, 2017, the Company had working capital of $173,702, and received an&#13;additional $906,500 subsequent to June 30, 2017 as proceeds from the Company&amp;#8217;s private placement of common stock and warrants&#13;(see Note 5). The Company will require significant additional capital to fund the implementation and execution of its business&#13;plan. This capital, which likely will be millions of dollars for a single drug candidate, will be required for research, regulatory&#13;applications, and clinical trials. At the present time, the Company does not have any commitments or known sources for this level&#13;of funding. These and other factors raise substantial doubt about the Company&amp;#8217;s ability to continue as a going concern.&#13;The accompanying financial statements do not include any adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability&#13;and classification of assets or the amounts and classification of liabilities that may result from the possible inability of the&#13;Company to continue as a going concern.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsAndChangesInAccountingPrinciplesTextBlock contextRef="From2017-07-01to2018-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 2 &amp;#8211; Recently Issued Accounting&#13;Pronouncements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In January 2017, the Financial Accounting&#13;Standards Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#8220;ASU&amp;#8221;) 2017-04, Intangibles - Goodwill and&#13;Other (Topic 350). ASU 2017-04 simplifies the subsequent measurement of goodwill by removing the second step of the two-step impairment&#13;test. The amendment requires an entity to perform its annual, or interim goodwill impairment test by comparing the fair value of&#13;a reporting unit with its carrying amount. An impairment charge should be recognized for the amount by which the carrying amount&#13;exceeds the reporting unit&amp;#8217;s fair value; however, the loss recognized should not exceed the total amount of goodwill allocated&#13;to that reporting unit. An entity still has the option to perform the qualitative assessment for a reporting unit to determine&#13;if the quantitative impairment test is necessary. The amendment should be applied on a prospective basis. ASU 2017-04 is effective&#13;for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2019, including interim periods within those fiscal years. Early adoption is permitted&#13;for interim or annual goodwill impairment tests performed on testing dates after January 1, 2017. The Company intends to early&#13;adopt the ASU in 2018.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In January 2017, the FASB issued ASU&#13;2017-01, Business Combinations (Topic 805): Clarifying the Definition of a Business, which clarifies the definition of a business&#13;to assist entities with evaluating whether transactions should be accounted for as acquisitions (or disposals) of assets or businesses.&#13;The standard will be effective for the Company in the first quarter of 2018. Early adoption is permitted. The Company is currently&#13;evaluating the impact of adopting this ASU on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;There are no other recently issued&#13;accounting pronouncements that the Company has yet to adopt that are expected to have a material effect on its financial position,&#13;results of operations, or cash flows.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsAndChangesInAccountingPrinciplesTextBlock>

    <us-gaap:BusinessCombinationDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2017-07-01to2018-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 3 &amp;#8211;Share Exchange Agreement&#13;and Acquisition Deposit&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On August 8, 2017, the Company entered&#13;into a Share Exchange Agreement, as amended and restated on October 13, 2017, (the &amp;#8220;Agreement&amp;#8221;), with BioPharma. Pursuant&#13;to the terms of the Agreement, the Company agreed to issue to the shareholders of BioPharma 42,642,712 post-reverse stock-split&#13;shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, par value $0.0001 (&amp;#8220;Common Stock&amp;#8221;), in exchange for all of the issued and&#13;outstanding shares of BioPharma capital stock, thereby making BioPharma a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. As part of the&#13;Closing of the Agreement, the 20,000,000 pre-reverse split shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock previously purchased by Intiva&#13;USA, effective on June 26, 2017 in a change in control transaction from the Company&amp;#8217;s control shareholders, shall be canceled.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Subsequent to the Closing, the Company&#13;agreed to undertake to implement certain corporate actions, including filing with the State of Delaware a Certificate of Amendment&#13;to the Company&amp;#8217;s Certificate of Incorporation to:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Increase the number of shares of authorized Common Stock to 200,000,000 shares from 100,000,000 shares.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Change the name of the company from Kinder Holding Corp. to Intiva BioPharma Inc.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Implement a one for six (1:6) reverse stock split of the Company&amp;#8217;s issued and outstanding shares of common stock, par value $0.0001 per share.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On October 13, 2017, the Closing of&#13;the Agreement became effective, and as a result of the Share Exchange, BioPharma became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company&#13;and the results of business will be consolidated on the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated financial statements. For financial reporting&#13;purposes, the transaction is to be accounted for as an additional capitalization of BioPharma with BioPharma as the accounting&#13;acquirer (reverse acquirer). The operations of BioPharma will be the continuing operations of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In June 2017, pursuant to a Debt Purchase&#13;Agreement, BioPharma paid $86,670 to a former director of the Company to satisfy the debt obligation of the Company to the director&#13;and for BioPharma to purchase the debt obligation. The amount paid and additional costs paid by BioPharma on behalf of the Company&#13;subsequent to June 30, 2017 of $12,900 aggregated $99,570, was classified as a non-current asset on the accompanying June 30,&#13;2017 consolidated balance sheet.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BusinessCombinationDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BusinessCombinationDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2017-03-27to2017-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 3 &amp;#8211; Share Exchange Agreement&#13;and Acquisition Deposit&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On August 8, 2017, the Company entered&#13;into a Share Exchange Agreement, as amended and restated on October 13, 2017, (the &amp;#8220;Agreement&amp;#8221;), with BioPharma. Pursuant&#13;to the terms of the Agreement, the Company agreed to issue to the shareholders of BioPharma 42,642,712 post-reverse stock-split&#13;shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, par value $0.0001 (&amp;#8220;Common Stock&amp;#8221;), in exchange for all of the issued and&#13;outstanding shares of BioPharma capital stock, thereby making BioPharma a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. As part of the&#13;Closing of the Agreement, the 20,000,000 pre-reverse split shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock previously purchased by Intiva&#13;USA, effective on June 26, 2017 in a change in control transaction from the Company&amp;#8217;s control shareholders, shall be canceled.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In June 2017, pursuant to a Debt Purchase&#13;Agreement, BioPharma paid $86,670 to a director of the Company to satisfy the Company&amp;#8217;s debt obligation to the director and&#13;for BioPharma to purchase the debt obligation. The amount paid is classified as a non-current asset on the accompanying June 30,&#13;2017 consolidated balance sheet.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;At June 30, 2017, BioPharma was owed&#13;$141,329 from Intiva USA for advances made by BioPharma on behalf of Intiva USA in conjunction with Intiva USA acquiring the controlling&#13;shareholding position in the Company. This amount is classified as a current asset on the accompanying June 30, 2017 consolidated&#13;balance sheet. Subsequent to June 30, 2017, $25,000 of the advance was repaid by Intiva USA.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BusinessCombinationDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2017-07-01to2018-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 5 &amp;#8211;Stockholders&amp;#8217;&#13;Equity&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Common stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In May 2017, BioPharma commenced a private&#13;placement of 1,116,400 units of Common Stock and Warrants at a price of $1.25 per unit. Each unit consisted of ten shares of Common&#13;Stock, one Class A Warrant to purchase one share of Common Stock at $0.25 per share, one Class B Warrant to purchase one share&#13;of Common Stock at $0.38 per share and one Class C Warrant to purchase one share of Common Stock at $0.50 per share. As of June&#13;30, 2017, 778,400 units had been sold, for total gross proceeds of $973,000, including 387,200 units which were subscribed but&#13;for which funds had not been received. The 3,872,000 shares underlying the subscribed units in the amount of $484,000 were included&#13;as issued and outstanding shares at June 30, 2017, and the related $484,000 subscription receivable was recorded as a component&#13;of stockholders&amp;#8217; equity on the June 30, 2017 consolidated balance sheet. Subsequent to June 30, 2017, the Company received&#13;proceeds of $484,000 for the subscribed shares. In July and August 2017, BioPharma sold an additional 338,000 units (3,380,000&#13;shares) for gross proceeds of $422,500.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On August 10, 2017, BioPharma adopted&#13;the &amp;#8220;2017 Stock Incentive Plan&amp;#8221; and granted an aggregate of 6,400,000 shares of BioPharma Common Stock to five officers&#13;and directors of the Company, valued at $800,000 ($0.125 per share). One-third of each grant vested as of the initial date of grant&#13;(August 10, 2017), and 8-1/3% upon the end of each calendar quarter beginning December 31, 2017. In March 2018, the Company cancelled&#13;1,166,667 unvested shares previously issued to its former CEO. As of March 31, 2018, 2,200,008 of the shares issued (valued at&#13;$275,001) are subject to forfeiture until vesting occurs.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On August 25, 2017, BioPharma entered&#13;into consulting agreements with two unrelated individuals for (i) developing and maintaining social media portals and (ii) identifying&#13;and developing potential strategic partners for the Company&amp;#8217;s various drug development activities. The agreements are each&#13;for a three-month term, payable monthly in shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, valued at $0.125 per share, of an aggregate&#13;304,800 shares and 138,000 shares, respectively. As of March 31, 2018, an aggregate 442,800 shares of common stock, valued at $55,350,&#13;representing all amounts due pursuant to the consulting agreements, have been issued to the two individuals.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On September 1, 2017, BioPharma commenced&#13;a private placement sale of its common stock at $0.25 per share. The Company sold 100,000 shares for gross proceeds of $25,000,&#13;before offering costs of $4,916.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In January 2018, BioPharma commenced&#13;a unit private placement of Common Stock and Warrants at a price of $2.10 per unit. Each Unit consisted of two shares of Common&#13;Stock and one Warrant to purchase an additional share of common stock at a price of $2.90 per share for a term of six months commencing&#13;with the date of acceptance of the underlying subscription agreement. As of March 31, 2018, the Company received proceeds of $25,200&#13;from the sale of 12,000 units.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On March 31, 2018, the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;board of directors approved and recommended for adoption by the stockholders of the Company a 2018 Equity Incentive Plan and has&#13;reserved 8,000,000 shares of Common Stock for issuance under the terms of that Plan. No awards have been granted under this Plan&#13;as of the date of this report.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Warrants&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The relative fair value of the warrants&#13;attached to the common stock issued in the May 2017 private placement of units was estimated at the date of grant using the Black-Sholes&#13;pricing model. The relative fair value attached to the common stock component is $1,139,573 and the relative fair value of the&#13;warrants is $255,927 as of the grant date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The following table summarizes information&#13;about warrants outstanding at March 31, 2018:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif;    &lt;td style="width: 20%; text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;203,100&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Class B&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;14,400&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;0.38&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;5,472&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Class C&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;12,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;0.50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;6,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The relative fair value of the warrants&#13;attached to the common stock issued in the January 2018 private placement of units was estimated at the date of grant using the&#13;Black-Sholes pricing model. The relative fair value attached to the common stock component is $19,762 and the relative fair value&#13;of the warrants is $5,438 as of the grant date. As of March 31, 2018, there are 12,000 warrants exercisable at a price of $2.90&#13;per share through July 15, 2018.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2017-03-27to2017-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 5 &amp;#8211; Stockholders&amp;#8217;&#13;Equity&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Common stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In March 2017, the Company issued 24,000,000&#13;shares of its common stock to Intiva USA as consideration for costs and expenses paid by Intiva USA on behalf of BioPharma and&#13;Intiva Kotzker aggregating $201,228.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In May 2017, a private placement of&#13;831,112 shares of BioPharma&amp;#8217;s Common Stock was completed at a price of $0.1125 per share, for total proceeds of $93,500,&#13;to three non-affiliates of BioPharma. One of the non-affiliate investors in the May 2017 private placement subsequently became&#13;a director and officer of BioPharma. Offering costs associated with the private placement of $6,545 were recorded against the gross&#13;proceeds received from the offering.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In May 2017, BioPharma commenced a private&#13;placement of 1,116,400 units of Common Stock and Warrants at a price of $1.25 per unit. Each unit consisted of ten shares of Common&#13;Stock, one Class A Warrant to purchase one share of Common Stock at $0.25 per share, one Class B Warrant to purchase one share&#13;of Common Stock at $0.38 per share and one Class C Warrant to purchase one share of Common Stock at $0.50 per share. As of June&#13;30, 2017, 778,400 units have been sold, for total gross proceeds of $973,000, including 387,200 units which were subscribed but&#13;for which funds had not been received. The 3,872,000 shares underlying the subscribed units in the amount of $484,000 are included&#13;as issued and outstanding shares at June 30, 2017, and the related $484,000 subscription receivable is recorded as a component&#13;of stockholders&amp;#8217; equity on the accompanying consolidated balance sheet. Subsequent to June 30, 2017, the Company received&#13;proceeds of $484,000 for the subscribed shares. Offering costs associated with the private placement of $22,464 were recorded against&#13;the gross proceeds received from the offering.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The relative fair value of the warrants&#13;attached to the common stock issued was estimated at the date of grant using the Black-Sholes pricing model. The relative fair&#13;value attached to the common stock component is $794,372 and the relative fair value of the warrants is $178,628 as of the grant&#13;date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The following table summarizes information about warrants&#13;outstanding at June 30, 2017:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif;     <NTVA:LicenseAgreementTextBlock contextRef="From2017-07-01to2018-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 4 &amp;#8211; License Agreement&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;In March&#13;2017, Intiva Kotzker licensed certain intellectual property from Kotzker Consulting LLC (&amp;#8220;Kotzker Consulting&amp;#8221;), an&#13;unrelated entity. The licensed intellectual property includes patent applications relating to the use of cannabinoid receptor modulators&#13;and terpenes in the acute treatment during exposure to organophosphorus nerve agents and/or organophosphorus insecticides. Under&#13;terms of the agreement&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 12pt"&gt;, &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Intiva Kotzker shall use its&#13;commercially reasonable efforts to develop and commercialize the licensed products, and, in particular, will be responsible for&#13;the design, manufacturing, preclinical, clinical, and regulatory development activities of the licensed products and shall bear&#13;the costs of such activities. As consideration for entering into the agreement, Intiva Kotzker agreed to: (i) pay Kotzker Consulting&#13;$180,000, (ii) pay patent prosecution costs incurred as of the date of the agreement of $15,000 and (iii) issue to Kotzker Consulting&#13;31,550 shares of Intiva Inc.&amp;#8217;s common stock valued at $78,875 ($2.50 per share based on recent private placement to third&#13;parties of Intiva Inc.&amp;#8217;s common stock). The Company has capitalized legal fees of $29,040 incurred in conjunction with acquiring&#13;the license agreement, As of June 30, 2017, $65,000 was due under the license agreement, which amount was paid in August 2017.&#13;The total value ascribed to the License Agreement with Kotzker Consulting is $302,915. The license agreement terminates, on a country&#13;by country basis, upon the expiration of the licensed patent for the licensed intellectual property, or when a competitor generic&#13;product utilizing the licensed technology is marketed in the particular country.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 28, 2018, the Company obtained&#13;a worldwide exclusive license with respect to a proprietary delivery system for cannabinoid-based medications. Upon execution&#13;of the agreement, $35,000 was paid to the licensor, and payments of $30,000 and $35,000 are required by August 31, 2018 and February&#13;28, 2019, respectively. The Company is required to pay milestone payments upon obtaining regulatory approval of pharmaceutical&#13;licensed products and royalties based upon sales of licensed products. The Company may grant sublicenses under the terms of the&#13;agreement.&lt;/p&gt;</NTVA:LicenseAgreementTextBlock>
    <NTVA:LicenseAgreementTextBlock contextRef="From2017-03-27to2017-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 4 &amp;#8211; License Agreement&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In March 2017, Intiva Kotzker licensed&#13;certain intellectual property from Kotzker Consulting LLC (&amp;#8220;Kotzker Consulting&amp;#8221;), an unrelated entity. The licensed&#13;intellectual property includes patent applications relating to the use of cannabinoid receptor modulators and terpenes in the acute&#13;treatment during exposure to organophosphorus nerve agents and/or organophosphorus insecticides. Under terms of the agreement,&#13;Intiva Kotzker shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to develop and commercialize the licensed products, and, in particular,&#13;will be responsible for the design, manufacturing, preclinical, clinical, and regulatory development activities of the licensed&#13;products and shall bear the costs of such activities. As consideration for entering into the agreement, Intiva Kotzker agreed to:&#13;(i) pay Kotzker Consulting $180,000, (ii) pay patent prosecution costs incurred as of the date of the agreement of $15,000 and&#13;(iii) issue to Kotzker Consulting 31,550 shares of Kanativa Inc.&amp;#8217;s common stock valued at $78,875 ($2.50 per share based&#13;on a contemporaneous private placement to third parties of Kanativa Inc.&amp;#8217;s common stock). The Company has capitalized legal&#13;fees of $29,040 incurred in conjunction with acquiring the license agreement. As of June 30, 2017, $65,000 was due under the license&#13;agreement, which amount was paid in August 2017. The license agreement terminates, on a country by country basis, upon the expiration&#13;of the licensed patent for the licensed intellectual property, or when a competitor generic product utilizing the licensed technology&#13;is marketed in the particular country.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Intiva Kotzker shall be responsible&#13;for development milestone payments for (i) licensed products for use as a preventative and therapeutic neuroprotective against&#13;nerve agents and pesticides and (ii) licensed products for treatment of diseases. Milestone payments for each of the foregoing&#13;will each be due in two payments, the first payment no later than thirty (30) days from acceptance of submission of the regulatory&#13;filing of the first licensed product and the second payment no later than thirty (30) days from approval of the first licensed&#13;product. Royalties will be due beginning with first commercial sale of developed products. The Company has completed and submitted&#13;a Pre-Investigational New Drug meeting request and amendment thereto with the FDA, with the objective of scheduling a meeting&#13;with the FDA in Washington, D.C, to discuss its proposed formulations and project development program.&lt;/p&gt;</NTVA:LicenseAgreementTextBlock>
